name: Banjo Paterson
what_did:
Banjo Paterson wrote poems and songs about the Australian bush.
He is best known for 'Waltzing Matilda' and 'The Man from Snowy River'.
His writing helped shape Australia’s national identity.
why_matters:
Banjo’s poems made Australians proud of their land and way of life.
He showed how powerful storytelling can be.
Many of his works are still loved today.

fun_fact: Banjo’s real name was Andrew — 'Banjo' was his horse’s name!
